name: Kofta Challow
cookingMethod: Ground beef is mixed with onions, garlic, turmeric, cumin, and cardamom, and shaped into meatballs (kofta). The kofta are then fried in oil until browned and cooked through. Separately, rice is cooked with water, salt, and black pepper, and served with the kofta on top.

name: Mantu
cookingMethod: A mixture of ground meat (beef or lamb), onions, garlic, ginger, coriander, cumin, salt, and black pepper is wrapped in wonton wrappers and steamed. The dumplings are then served with a yogurt sauce.

name: Qabili Palau
cookingMethod: Rice is cooked with lamb, onions, garlic, cumin, and cardamom until tender. Separately, carrots are sliced and caramelized in oil. The rice and meat are then combined and topped with the caramelized carrots, raisins, and almonds.

name: Bolani
cookingMethod: A dough is made from flour and water, and mashed potatoes, onions, garlic, cilantro, salt, and black pepper are added. The dough is rolled into thin circles, filled with the potato mixture, and fried in oil until crispy.

name: Kabuli Pulao
cookingMethod: Rice is cooked with meat (lamb or beef), caramelized onions, garlic, and spices (cardamom, cumin, and black pepper) until tender. Separately, raisins and almonds are toasted in oil and added to the rice before baking it in the oven.

name: Aush
cookingMethod: Beef, onions, garlic, turmeric, coriander, mint, salt, and black pepper are cooked together with water to make a broth. Separately, noodles are boiled until tender. The noodles and broth are combined and topped with yogurt, lemon juice, and a sprinkle of black pepper.

name: Borani Banjan
cookingMethod: Eggplant is sliced and fried until browned, then combined with tomatoes, onions, garlic, mint, salt, and black pepper. The mixture is cooked until the vegetables are soft, then topped with yogurt before serving.

name: Shinwari Kebab
cookingMethod: Lamb is marinated in a mixture of onions, garlic, ginger, green chilies, salt, and black pepper. The meat is then skewered and grilled over an open flame until browned and cooked through.

name: Goshtaba
cookingMethod: Ground meat (beef or lamb) is mixed with onions, garlic, ginger, cardamom, cinnamon, salt, and black pepper, and shaped into meatballs. The meatballs are then simmered in a yogurt sauce thickened with flour, until the sauce is creamy and the meatballs are cooked through.

name: Maurgh Pulao
cookingMethod: Chicken is cooked with onions, garlic, cardamom, cumin, and black pepper until tender. Separately, rice is cooked with water and salt. The rice and chicken are then combined and topped with raisins and almonds that have been toasted in oil.

name: Bamya Chalaw
cookingMethod: Lamb is browned in oil with onions, garlic, turmeric, cumin, cayenne pepper, and salt, then simmered with water until tender. Separately, okra is sautéed in oil with tomatoes, garlic, and salt. The lamb and okra mixture is then combined and served with rice.

name: Firnee
cookingMethod: Milk is simmered with sugar, cardamom, and cornstarch until thickened. The mixture is then poured into bowls and chilled. The dish is garnished with chopped pistachios and a drizzle of rosewater.

name: Shirin Polow
cookingMethod: Basmati rice is cooked with oil, cinnamon, cardamom, and salt. Separately, carrots are sautéed with sugar and cinnamon until caramelized. Raisins and almonds are toasted in oil. The rice is then layered with the carrot mixture and topped with the raisins and almonds.

name: Kofta Bozbash
cookingMethod: Lamb is browned in oil with onions, garlic, turmeric, cumin, cayenne pepper, and salt, then simmered with water until tender. Separately, potatoes are sautéed with tomatoes and chickpeas until tender. The lamb and potato mixture is then combined and served with bread.

name: Biryani
cookingMethod: Cook rice with spices, then layer with cooked meat and onions. Bake or steam until fully cooked.

name: Haleem
cookingMethod: Slow cook a mixture of wheat, meat, and lentils until tender. Then mash and mix with spices and seasonings.

name: Nihari
cookingMethod: Slow cook beef shank with spices and seasonings until tender. Then thicken with a mixture of flour and yogurt.

name: Chapli Kebab
cookingMethod: Mix minced meat with spices and onions, then shape into flat patties. Fry until cooked and serve with tomatoes and eggs.

name: Samosa
cookingMethod: Make a flour-based dough and fill with a mixture of mashed potatoes, peas, and spices. Then fry until crispy.

name: Aloo Palak
cookingMethod: Cook spinach with spices, tomato, and onion. Then add cooked potatoes and continue to cook until fully combined.

name: Bhuna Gosht
cookingMethod: Cook meat with spices, tomato, onion, and yogurt until tender. Then cook down until the sauce is thick and flavorful.

name: Aloo Gobi
cookingMethod: Cook cauliflower and potatoes with spices, tomato, and onion until fully cooked and combined.

name: Shami Kebab
cookingMethod: Boil meat and chickpeas until tender, then mash and mix with spices and onions. Shape into flat patties and fry until cooked.

name: Jalebi
cookingMethod: Mix flour, corn flour, and yogurt to make a batter. Let it ferment for a few hours. Make a sugar syrup with water, sugar, and saffron. Heat oil in a pan, pour the batter into a spiral shape and deep-fry until golden brown. Soak the jalebis in the sugar syrup for a few minutes.

name: Kheer
cookingMethod: Wash and soak rice for a few hours. Cook the rice in milk until soft, add sugar and cardamom and let it cook for a few more minutes. Garnish with chopped pistachios, almonds, and raisins.
